Heading: Raised by
Value: Both Parents: Tom and Jan Bunting

Heading: Did serial killer spend time in an orphanage?
Did serial killer spend time in a foster home?
Was serial killer ever raised by a relative?
Did serial killer live with a step-parent?
Physical defect?
Value: He has no sense of smell when he was born.

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: Yes; around 8 years old by friend’s older brother

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: Yes; by his friend’s older brother

Heading: Sexually abused?
Value: Yes; around 8 years old by friend’s older brother

Heading: Age when first had intercourse
Value: Age of 15 and got her pregnant

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Fired from jobs?
Value: Yes, but only because they couldn’t afford to pay him at the crematorium. They thought he was a good worker.

Heading: Types of jobs worked
Value: Age 20 he worked for a crematorium. Age 22 he worked at a SA Meat Corporation: slaughtering animals.

Heading: Employment status during series
Value: None, because he was stealing money from his victims after their death.

Heading: Marital status
Value: Veronika Tripp: First marriage in 1989, Elizabeth Harvey: Second marriage

Heading: Number of children
Value: Four step-sons: Troy Youde, James Vlassakis, Adrian Vlassakis, and Kristoffer Vlassakis

Heading: Lives with his children
Value: Adrian and Kristoffer Vlassakis lived with him and Mrs. Harvey more constantly than the other two. James lived with them for longer than Troy. Troy and James moved out when they got older.

Heading: Animal torture
Value: Yes; During childhood Bunting tortured ants with acid. In late adulthood, he would kill and skin cats and dogs while making James Vlassakis watch. Sometimes Bunting made James Vlassakis participate whether he wanted to or not.

Heading: Committed previous crimes?
Value: No, just tortured animals. No criminal crimes.

Heading: Number of victims
Value: 11 victims, but 12 bodies were found. Suzanne Allen’s murder became dropped due to the lack of evidence and claimed she died of natural causes, a heart attack.

Heading: Victim type
Value: Pedophiles, homosexuals, cross dresser, heroin user and roommate, partners assisting in the crimes, mentally

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Value: He was 25-years-old at the time of the first murder, but was turning 26 years two months later.

Heading: Date of first kill in series
Date of final kill in series
Age of victims
Value: Thomas Trevilyan: 18; Fredrick Brooks: 18;  Michael Gardiner: 19; Troy Younde:21; Clinton Tresize: 22; David Johnson: 24; Ray Davies: 26; Gavin Porter: 29; Garry O’Dwyer: 29; Elizabeth Haydon: 37; Barry Lane: 42

Heading: Method of killing
Value: Torture that led to eventual strangulation by a rope or electrical cord

Heading: Weapon
Value: Knives, Coils of rope, rolls of tape, rubber gloves, cloths, a Variac metallurgy tool that the killers used to give electric shocks to the genitals and other sensitive parts.

Heading: Did killer have a partner?
Value: Yes; Bunting was the leader of three other men.

Heading: Name of partner
Value: Robert Wagner ‘Papa Smurf’, James Vlassakis, and Mark Haydon were the three main group members. However, Elizabeth Harvey, Thomas Trevilyan, and Barry Lane each assisted in one of the murdered victims.

Heading: Sex of partner
Value: The main group consisted of three males. Robert Wagner was a homosexual, while James Vlassakis and Mark Haydon were heterosexuals.

Heading: Type of serial killer
Value: Missionary, Organized Lust, and Contract Killer

Heading: Location of first contact
Value: Victim home, killer home, street, hospital, etc.

Heading: Location of killing
Value: Victim’s home, Bunting’s home, Kersbrook, Australia, and at the Snowtown Bank.

Heading: Tortured victims?
Value: Yes; giving electric shocks to sensitive parts (generally genitals) of the body, crushing toes with pliers, ears and nose burned with cigarettes, and one victim even had a sparkler inserted into his genitals and lit. After being tortured the victims were strangled and to make sure they were dead, someone would jump on their chest to get all of the remaining air out.

Heading: Stalked victims?
Value: Only to get personal information to obtain financial gains from victim (after they were murdered).

Heading: Quick & efficient?
Value: No, he tortured all of his victims except for one.

Heading: Bound the victims?
Value: Yes, using handcuffs, electrical cord, and/ or duct tape over the mouth with a sock in it

Heading: Mutilated body?
Value: Yes; almost of the victims’ bodies were cut up with a knife and eight of them were placed in a barrel containing acid.

Heading: Ate part of the body?
Value: Bunting and Wagner fried up and ate parts of David Johnson’s flesh.

Heading: Took totem – personal item
Value: Yes; from each victim personal information was taken in order to be able to access victim’s finances. These included credit cards, photo IDs, social security numbers, and other items.

Heading: Robbed victim or location
Value: After each victim was murdered, their property was taken over, such as a car or house, to gain more money.

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Value: Thomas Trevilyan was the one victim who was left at the scene, because it was supposed to look like a suicide. He was found hanging from a tree in the Kersbook area.

Heading: Date convicted
Value: 9/08/2003. Outstanding murder charges of Suzanne Allen were dropped on 5/7/2007 when jury could not reach a verdict

Heading: Did serial killer confess?
Value: Yes, but Bunting confessed after conviction (confessed & recanted).

Heading: Name and state of prison
Value: E Division in Yatala Prison, South Australia’s Maximum Security Jail in Adelaide.
